# AudioUnitParameterUnit.absoluteCents

**Case**

An absolute unit of measure for the musical pitch of a note.

## Declaration

```swift
case absoluteCents
```

## Discussion

Absolute musical pitch in cents. 1,200 cents are equal to one octave. If `f` is a frequency in hertz, then `absoluteCents = 1200 * log2 (f/440) + 6900`. See also the [doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentation/AudioToolbox/AudioUnitParameterUnit/cents] property.

## Enumeration Cases

- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.BPM**: A whole-number unit of measure for musical tempo, representing beats per minute.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.beats**: A time unit of measure in musical beats.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.boolean**: A Boolean-like unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.cents**: A logarithmic unit of measure for a musical interval between two notes.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.customUnit**: A custom unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.decibels**: A logarithmic unit of measure representing the ratio between two audio levels.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.degrees**: An angular degree unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.equalPowerCrossfade**: An audio power unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.generic**: A generic unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.hertz**: A hertz unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.indexed**: An indexed unit of measure.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.linearGain**: A linear unit of measure representing the difference between two audio levels.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.midiController**: A whole-number unit of measure corresponding to standard MIDI control numbers.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.midiNoteNumber**: A whole-number unit of measure corresponding to audio frequency.
- **AudioUnitParameterUnit.meters**: A distance unit of measure, corresponding to meters.
